main.name: Sound
main.description:
An `Sound` plugin based on the HTML5 `<audio>` tag. No Web Audio API here, so it is compatible with many browsers.

> __Note:__ Before using this plugin, `Sound.game` must be set to the Game this plugin is a part of, and that Game must have an Assets plugin loaded, which must be compatible with the`assets-xhr` plugin, because `sound-xhr` relies on that plugin (or any compatible one) for the loading of audio files.

> `Sound.Init()` will automatically set `Sound.game` to your Game. Just make sure load the right Assets plugin and call `Sound.Init` before you use `sound-xhr`.

children.name: load
children.description: Add a sound (`<audio>` element) to the Game. Calls `Assets.load()` directly, so you can use that one if you like.

arguments.name: URL
arguments.description: The URL that point to the audio file, or an array of URLs (will be added as individual `<source>` tags).

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The optional, unique name of this sound, so you can easily play it later on.

children.name: get
children.description: Get the sound with the given name or URL. Calls `Assets.get()` directly, so you can use that one, if you like.

arguments.name: URL/name
arguments.description: The name or URL of the sound to get. Used exactly as `Game.assets.load()` on the `assets-dom` plugin.

children.name: play
children.description: Play the sound with given name. This actually just perfomrs a `get()` and executes `.play()` on the result.

arguments.name: name/URL
arguments.description: The name or URL of the sound, as passed to `Game.sound.get()`.

children.name: pause
children.description: Pause the sound with given name. This actually just perfomrs a `get()` and executes `.pause()` on the result.

arguments.name: name/URL
arguments.description: The name or URL of the sound, as passed to `Game.sound.get()`.

children.name: stop
children.description: Stop the sound with given name. This actually just performs a `get()` and executes `.pause()` on the result. This sets `currentTime` to `0` on the `<audio>` element. That way, it won't start off where it was paused when you play it again.

arguments.name: name/URL
arguments.description: The name or URL of the sound, as passed to `Game.sound.get()`.
